reviewText:
The living Edens series just happens to be a product of the time shortly before the DVD format. It shows how far we have come in such a short time. At any rate, Faye Dunaway's narration was stellar with a type of professionalism of a college speech and english professor. She tells Thailand's story with keen inflexion and sophisticated integrity. The problem with this Living Edens is "like the rest" a brief time to explain and cover huge territories and as a result the series is forced to concentrate on the familiar or cliche'd aspects of a given biome or region. With that said we end up missing a great deal of what the area/s has to offer.

In reflecting it was a nice documentary among the best of the Living Edens series but nothing of anything really special by todays standards.

i truly enjoyed this show on PBS, this episode especially. I really enjoyed the Buddhist tie in and the amazing Luna moth footage. i wish this series would come out on DVD, i would own it in a minute.
